role.documentation: Amounts received under the terms of the agreement between the county, city, and slot machine operators. Both the city and county should use this account to recognize the slot machine revenue (even though the city’s portion goes through the county). The portion that is to be kept by the county is coded as 369.400 - Slot Machine Proceeds while the portion belonging to the city is coded as a liability. Then, the county forwards the city’s portion to the city where it is recorded as 369.400 - Slot Machine Proceeds by the city.
role.label: 369.400 - Slot Machine Proceeds

role.documentation: Amounts received under the terms of the agreement between the county, city, and slot machine operators. Both the city and county should use this account to recognize the slot machine revenue (even though the city's portion goes through the county). Per the agreement, slot machine operators remit a portion of their revenues to the county. The county divides up the money into two accounts; one for the county and one for the city. The portion that is to be kept by the county is coded as 369.500 - Slot Machine Proceeds while the portion belonging to the city is coded as a liability. Then, the county forwards the city's portion to the city where it is recorded as 369.600 - Slot Machine Proceeds by the city.
role.label: 369.500 - Slot Machine Proceeds

role.documentation: Amounts received under the terms of the agreement between the county, city, and slot machine operators. Both the city and county should use this account to recognize the slot machine revenue (even though the city's portion goes through the county). Per the agreement, slot machine operators remit a portion of their revenues to the county. The county divides up the money into two accounts; one for the county and one for the city. The portion that is to be kept by the county is coded as 369.500 - Slot Machine Proceeds while the portion belonging to the city is coded as a liability. Then, the county forwards the city's portion to the city where it is recorded as 369.600 - Slot Machine Proceeds by the city.
role.label: 369.600 - Slot Machine Proceeds

r0.Name: Codification of Accounting and Financial Reporting Guidance Contained

r252.DeprecatedLabel: Code moved to Revenue Account Codes 335.430-335.480

r253.DEWCalculation: Can be calculated (if you do not produce a balance sheet) by adding the fair market value of all investments (both current and non-current) to the cash on hand and the cash in the bank.
r253.DEWSource: Found on the Balance Sheet for Governmental Funds in the Assets Section (some may be in major while others are in non major)

r254.DEWCalculation: Can be calculated (if you do not produce a balance sheet) by summing all liabilities that fall into the “Current” category for all Governmental Funds.
r254.DEWSource: Found on the Balance Sheet for Governmental Funds

r255.DEWCalculation: Can be calculated (if you do not produce a Statement of Revenues, Expenditures, and changes in Fund Balances for Governmental Funds) by summing amounts paid for Interest and Principal on amounts borrowed (including principal payments on retirement) and other fiscal charges related to the borrowed amount.
r255.DEWSource: Found on the Statement of Revenues, Expenditures, and Changes in Fund Balances for Governmental Funds in the Expenditures section.

r256.DEWCalculation: Can be calculated (if you do not produce a Statement of Revenues, Expenditures, and changes in Fund Balances for Governmental Funds) by summing all revenues received from other governmental entities during the fiscal year.
r256.DEWSource: Found on the Statement of Revenues, Expenditures, and Changes in Fund Balances for Governmental Funds under Revenues.

r257.DEWCalculation: Can be calculated (if you do not produce the reconciliation) by summing all liabilities that fall into the “Non-Current” or “Long-Term” category for all Governmental Funds
r257.DEWSource: Found on the Reconciliation of the Balance Sheet to the Statement of Net Assets – Governmental Funds

r258.DEWCalculation: Can be calculated (if you do not produce a Statement of Net Assets) by subtracting total liabilities from total assets and then remove any balances that are restricted for a specific use or are invested in capital assets (net of accumulated depreciation, less any outstanding debt remaining on the capital assets).
r258.DEWSource: Found on the Statement of Net Assets for Proprietary Funds in the Net Assets section.

r259.DEWCalculation: Can be calculated (if you do not produce a Statement of Revenues, Expenditures, and changes in Fund Balances for Governmental Funds) by summing all expenditures received during the fiscal year including Capital Outlay and current Debt Service payments. NOTE: This amount should match what’s recorded in the Expenditure section of the AFR’s Governmental Funds.
r259.DEWSource: Found on the Statement of Revenues, Expenditures, and Changes in Fund Balances for Governmental Funds

r260.DEWCalculation: Can be calculated (if you do not produce a Statement of Revenues, Expenditures, and Changes in Fund Net Assets for Proprietary Funds) by summing all expenses included in the cost of producing and providing goods and services to customers as well as the cost of collecting payment from them.
r260.DEWSource: Found on the Statement of Revenues, Expenditures, and Changes in Fund Net Assets for Proprietary Funds as a total below the Operating Revenues and Expenses sections.

r261.DEWCalculation: Can be calculated (if you do not produce a Statement of Revenues, Expenditures, and Changes in Fund Net Assets for Proprietary Funds) by summing all fees and charges generated by producing and providing goods and services to customers.
r261.DEWSource: Found on the Statement of Revenues, Expenditures, and Changes in Fund Net Assets for Proprietary Funds.

r262.DEWCalculation: Can be calculated (if you do not produce a Statement of Revenues, Expenditures, and changes in Fund Balances for Governmental Funds) by summing all revenues for the fiscal year including taxes, special assessments, licenses and permits, etc.  Make sure to include Intergovernmental Revenues as well. NOTE: This amount should match what’s recorded in the Revenue section of the AFR’s Governmental Funds.
r262.DEWSource: Found on the Statement of Revenues, Expenditures, and Changes in Fund Balances for Governmental Funds as a total of all revenues listed.
